Tolkien-related events that took place in 1943.

content.title: January
content.content:
11 - Michael George Tolkien, grandson of J.R.R. Tolkien, is born.
29 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to J.L.N. O'Loughlin.

content.title: April
content.content:
10 - Bo Hansson, who will become famous for his music inspired by The Lord of the Rings, is born.
20 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 48.

content.title: July
content.content:
? - Christopher Tolkien joins the Royal Air Force.
28 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 49a.

content.title: August
content.content:
3 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Leila Keene and Pat Kirke.
10 - Actor Peter McKenzie is born.
16 - Actress Sharon Baird is born.
20 - Actor Sylvester McCoy is born.

content.title: September
content.content:
1 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 49b.
8 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 49c.
9 - Renowned scholar Tom Shippey is born.
13 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 49d.
19 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 49e.

content.title: October
content.content:
25 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 50.
27 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 51.
31 - Writer J.E.A. Tyler is born.

content.title: November
content.content:
3 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 51a.
10 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 51b.
29 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 52.

content.title: December
content.content:
9 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 53.
15 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 53a.
25 - Father Christmas writes his last letter to J.R.R. Tolkien's children.
31 - Actor Victor Raider-Wexler is born.

content.title: Unknown
content.content: Early[note 1] - Christopher Tolkien draws a large-scale map of the Shire that would many years later be the basis for A Part of the Shire.[1]

content.title: Notes
content.content: ↑ This must have been during the first half of the year, considering that Christopher left for South Africa in July
